text.text: For example, Hammers are pretty much always blunt weapons, while Broadswords are likely to adhere to the distribution of their head material. Similarly, Firewood heads will always make your weapons inflict Fire damage, while Iron heads will stick to the base distribution of the weapon.

The distribution and influence of a material can be found on one of its head pieces. The following pages after this introduction list the base distribution and bias (the resistance the tool has for the base distribution to be changed by its head(s)) for each tool. It then provides a summary of each material's distribution bias for reference.
